title: Sienna Miller joins Robert De Niro and Paul Rudd on The Graham Norton Show
text:
The Graham Norton Show boasts star-studded line-up for Friday night's episode.

The TV host will be joined by Sienna Miller as well as A-listers Robert De Niro and Paul Rudd, as well as Bruce Springsteen and James Blunt.

British actress Sienna, 37, looks incredible in a pale pink gown in the first look images from the upcoming installment.

In conversation: The Graham Norton Show boasts star-studded line-up for Friday night's episode, with Sienna Miller taking her place on the red sofa

Sienna takes pride of place on the sofa alongside De Niro and Rudd, exuding old school Hollywood glamour in her glamorous gown.

Fans can tune into The Graham Norton Show when it airs at 10.35pm on BBC One this Friday night.

Portraying a single mother whose teenage daughter suddenly disappears in American Woman was a 'grueling' role for Sienna.

Joining forces: The TV host will be joined by Sienna Miller as well as A-listers Robert De Niro and Paul Rudd, as well as Bruce Springsteen and James Blunt

Stunning: Sienna takes pride of place on the sofa alongside De Niro and Rudd, exuding old school Hollywood glamour in her glamorous gown

Miller plays Debra, a 32-year old supermarket cashier whose daughter Bridget, a mother herself, fails to return home after a night out.

Set in rural Pennsylvania, the harrowing drama follows Debra over the course of 11 years as she looks after Bridget's toddler son and faces personal hardships.

'It was grueling ... The idea of exploring that, the unimaginable, my worst nightmare, felt interesting and that being said when I agreed to do the film I was praying I wouldn't have to because I started to dread what that would be and it was impossibly hard,' she told Reuters in an interview.

Main man: Also putting in an appearance on the chat show will be US superstar Bruce Springsteen

'Obviously not nearly as hard as the actual experience but I spent a lot of time with people who had gone through that and it was crushing.

'But we were a very strong group of cast members and filmmakers and everybody was very supportive throughout, which I think I really needed.'

Sienna, who has a young daughter named Marlowe, is known for supporting roles in dramas American Sniper and Foxcatcher but she said American Woman was harder than her past work.

Performing: The studio audience was serenaded by James Blunt on Friday night's show

'There were moments where I completely fell apart ... I think anybody would, but I felt supported and I had my daughter to go home to every night which is a huge blessing,' she said.

Critics have praised her performance as Debra, who transforms from brusque mistress to a more settled grandmother.

'Women are often left to pick up the pieces of a broken life and struggle through it and do their best', she reflected.
description: The Graham Norton Show boasts star-studded line-up for Friday night's episode.
